moves.7... Qh4: a wasted move on my part.. I should be developing pieces
moves.8... Nxd4: I feared Nxe6, either stranding the d-pawn or opening the f-file before I can castle
moves.12. O-O-O: Should I grab the f2 pawn?
moves.12... Bxc3: no, I'll dispose of the knight (I dislike opponents' knights)
moves.13. Qxc3: the e4 pawn looks tastier than the f2 pawn
moves.13... Qxe4 14. Bf3: ok, f2 would have been better...
moves.15. Kb1 d5: I needed to block the diagonal so I could get the bishop out without losing the b7 pawn
moves.17... Bd7: I'll attempt to patch the hole in my pawn structure with the bishop so I can castle
moves.19. g4: he still wants the queen to go home
moves.20... Qe7: I'll see if he's in a trading mood
moves.21... Kxe7: probably should have taken it with the knight and then castled
moves.25... Nc5: I threaten the rook and pin the bishop
moves.26... Nxd3: so I snatch the rook (and threaten the other rook)
moves.28. Rd1: he protects his now isolated pawn
moves.29. Rh1: I think he should have just advanced the pawn...
moves.29... Rxd3: because now I grab the isolated one and I'm back to even.
moves.30. Kc2: he tries to run off my rook
moves.31... f6: I try to breakup the joined pawns
moves.34. f3: I suspect he's trying to link this pawn with the other two
moves.34... e5: that would be bad for me!
moves.36... Rb4: I try to take advantage of it
moves.37. Rc2: I'm assuming he really meant to go to b2?
moves.38. Kf2 fxg5: with the rook off the h-file, I can trade these pawns now
moves.39. hxg5 Kf5: I probably should have went to the d-file to protect the naked pawn
moves.40. Rxc6: he took long enough taking it! (I would have taken it 2 moves ago)
moves.40... Ra3: he leaves me a way to nab another..
moves.42. Kg3: he's still trying tro link the backward pawn
moves.42... Kxg5: I decide to trade before he can connect them
moves.43. Rxe5+: he completes the trade, checking me in the process
moves.43... Kf6: I want to stay opposite the opponent's last pawn (and attack the rook)
moves.45. Kg4: where I expected him to move
moves.45... Ra1: the rook is more mobile and safer far away
moves.47. f5+: I expected that (but I have a plan)
moves.48. Rh6+: he doesn't want the pawn yet (I would have grabbed it)
moves.48... Kg7: I protect my pawn and attack his rook
moves.49. Kg5: he moves his King in closer to protect the rook and pawn
moves.49... Rg1+: my rook gets in on the action! (and his rook is a goner!)
moves.50. Kh5: he tries to protect it, but it can't be saved
moves.50... Rh1+: check again, and the rook will die... he see the inevitable and resigns
